text: Groupthink w  a British Provocateur  Books to Video  Provocateur Douglas Murray takes big swings in his brand new international bestseller  The Madness of Crowds  The Overton window is shrinking as our allowed topics of discussion are increasingly chose from top down pushing more people towards the socially engineered fringes  Race baiting has gotten so obvious that for the first time in   years a record number of minority votes went to a conservative candidate  The progressive agenda is skipping over inherent human rights violations like sovereign drug consumption and instead is campaigning for reparation checks and to disallow airline travel  A traditional liberal Brit  Douglas  admits logical consistency and ethical constitution aren t part of the social justice warrior lexicon   From a gay author  this dense read tackles homophobia  transphobia and racism  the latest accusations of a nonbeliever in the public square which are neither provable nor disprovable  Murray shows it isn t a good versus evil battle but a software versus hardware misunderstanding of what it means to truly be in a minority  Douglas has no reservations bringing up post operation suicide rates and  psychosexual  witch doctors as the new conversion camps convincing young men to lop off their cocks  While this book hits every inflammatory topic imaginable its imperative to remember what John Stuart Mill famously said   Free speech is necessary for a free society  Today we hear the ideas of a homosexual man writing openly about the tendencies and hijacking of his own community  We ve entered a postmodern age of cultural marxism where he who feels most oppressed has more value than he who works hardest YouTube   https www youtube com watch v wWdofVu Ro https www youtube com watch v wWdofVu Ro iTunes   https podcasts apple com us podcast nicks non fiction id https podcasts apple com us podcast nicks non fiction id SoundCloud   https soundcloud com user nicks non fiction the madness of crowds https soundcloud com user nicks non fiction the madness of crowds
